name: Alice Sebold's "The Lovely Bones" Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Salmon.

	When Susie introduced herself in the first sentence of the book, she said her last name was 'like the fish'.

questions.text: How old was Susie when she was killed?
questions.explanation:
14.

	Susie was killed on December 6, 1973, in a cornfield by a man that lived in their neighborhood named Mr. Harvey.

questions.text: What was the name of the boy Susie liked?
questions.explanation:
Ray.

	After Susie's death, Ray became friends with a shy girl named Ruth.

questions.text: Where was Susie living when she was telling the story?
questions.explanation:
Heaven.

	Susie made a friend named Holly who told her about what it was like living in Heaven.

questions.text: Where did Susie's mom, Abigail, travel to after she left the family?
questions.explanation:
California.

	After Susie died, Abigail traveled to California where she worked in a winery. After her husband had a heart attack, she returned home.

	Mr. Harvey put Susie's remains in a safe and threw into a sinkhole.

questions.text: How many people did Mr. Harvey kill before he killed Susie?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Mr. Harvey killed two 13-year-old girls named Jackie Meyer and Wendy Richter, a 12-year-old girl named Leah Fox, an 8-year-old girl named Flora Hernandez, a 6-year-old girl named Leidia Johnson, and a 49-year-old woman named Sophie Cichetti.

questions.text: Susie's dad knew Mr. Harvey killed Susie.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He figured it out, but he could never prove it.

questions.correct: He fell and froze to death
questions.explanation:
He fell and froze to death.

	Mr. Harvey was going after another woman to kill when he fell and eventually froze to death.

questions.text: How long before Susie's charm bracelet was found?
questions.explanation:
14 years later.

	Fourteen years after her death, her charm bracelet was found and given to someone else as a gift.
